articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Yemen's Iran-aligned Houthi group has agreed to a temporary truce to allow tugboats and rescue ships to reach the damaged Greek-flagged crude oil tanker Sounion in the Red Sea, Iran's mission to the United Nations in New York said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Iran says Houthis agree to truce so boats can reach damaged oil tanker

articles.author: Jonathan Landay
articles.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin will mount a counteroffensive to try to retake territory in the Kursk region captured by Ukrainian troops, but Russian forces will encounter "a difficult fight," Deputy CIA Director David Cohen said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Russia faces "difficult fight" to retake Ukraine-held area, says top US spy

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces sent tanks deeper into Khan Younis in the southern Gaza Strip and launched strikes across the enclave as they battled Hamas-led militants, killing at least 34 Palestinians on Wednesday, according to medics.
articles.title: Israeli forces launch strikes across Gaza, push tanks into central Khan Younis

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: French investigative judges are due to decide later on Wednesday whether to place Russian-born Telegram boss Pavel Durov under formal investigation following his arrest as part of a probe into organised crime on the messaging app.
articles.title: French judges to decide on next step in Durov probe

articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt
articles.description: Top U.S. and Chinese officials will wrap up talks in Beijing after a third day of meetings on Thursday that were intended to ease simmering tensions between the two superpowers ahead of the Nov. 5 U.S. election.
articles.title: US, Chinese officials to wrap up talks in Beijing on Taiwan, fentanyl

articles.author: Kirsty Needham
articles.description: The United States will work with Pacific Island nations to rein in drug trafficking by criminal networks from China, which use the region as a way station for narcotics exports to the U.S., Deputy Secretary of State Kurt Campbell said on Thursday.
articles.title: US to step up work with Pacific nations to halt drug trafficking

articles.author: Elizabeth Piper
articles.description: The 38-year-old father of four’s combat experience and sharp wit made him indispensable to Reuters journalists on the frontlines. ”Are you ok?” was a question Evans repeatedly asked.
articles.title: Ryan Evans, killed in Ukraine, played a vital role for Reuters

articles.author: Satoshi Sugiyama, Kiyoshi Takenaka
articles.description: At least three people were killed in southwestern Japan on Thursday as Typhoon Shanshan made landfall in Kagoshima prefecture, bringing heavy rain and very strong winds as well as snarling air traffic and knocking out power to over a quarter million households.
articles.title: Typhoon Shanshan makes landfall in Japan, killing 3 and snarling air traffic

articles.author: Tim Kelly
articles.description: The intrusion of a Chinese spy plane into Japanese airspace is a "wake-up call" for Tokyo about the aggressive nature of China's leadership, U.S. lawmaker John Moolenaar, who chairs the House Select Committee on China said on Wednesday.
articles.title: China's airspace intrusion a 'wake-up call' for Japan, says U.S. Republican lawmaker

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A devastating typhoon that tore through the Philippines, Taiwan and China last month, destroying infrastructure and leaving more than 100 people dead, was made significantly worse by human-induced climate change, scientists said in a report on Thursday.
articles.title: Deadly typhoon Gaemi made worse by climate change, scientists say
